headline: No, it’s Not an Episode of Jerry Springer: Ohio GOP Senate Front-Runners Nearly Come to Blows During HEATED Primary Debate (VIDEO)
author: Julian Conradson
sentences: The question was about Russia, China, and how Congress approved billions in aid for Ukraine, to which Mandel claimed that Gibbons made “billions of dollars” shipping Ohio businesses to China and owning a Chinese petro company’s stock, which forced Gibbons to stand up and respond to his accusations.

TRENDING: Newsmax Host Greg Kelly: "Kevin McCarthy Is a Swamp Snake and We Don't Like Him - In a Moment of Crisis He Wet His Pants" (VIDEO)
“You might not understand this cause you’ve never been in the private sector in your entire life,” Gibbons said with a grin.

Both candidates are currently sitting atop the polls, with Josh Mandel being the consensus front-runner for months, and Gibbons coming on strong of late, surging to the top spot among GOP Senate candidates in two recent independent surveys.

Sensing his opportunity to kick the front-runners over their foolishness, JD Vance, another candidate for Ohio’s GOP Senate nomination, excoriated Mandel and Gibbons for their temper tantrum once the ruckus had cooled down.

— Andrew Surabian (@Surabees) March 19, 2022
In a Fox News poll released on March 7, Gibbons led public opinion with 22% support, followed by Mandel (20%), and Vance (11%), rounding out the top three.
The video shows the exchange starting when Gibbons, a Cleveland investment banker, accuses Mandel, a former Marine and current State representative, of never having worked in the private sector.
Fireworks erupted at Friday’s Republican Senate primary in Ohio when two of the leading candidates for the GOP nomination got in each other’s faces and nearly went full fisticuffs on stage.
As the only other person whose served his country in uniform – I enlisted in the united states marine core -… I think the way you use the United States Marine CORPS, Josh, is disgraceful.
Four others, former Ohio Republican Party chair Jane Timken (9%), State Sen. Matt Dolan (7%), businessman Neil Patel (2%), and businessman Mark Pukita (1%), all checked in at under 10%.

“I would have loved to have made millions off Chinese petro.”
Immediately following this exchange is when Mandel jumped up and confronted Gibbons face-to-face.

pic.twitter.com/D2usfDqoXe
— Natalie Allison (@natalie_allison) March 19, 2022
The tense altercation came shortly after the debate kicked off.
The recent poll results showed a dramatic change in public sentiment from previous surveys, all of which had showed Mandel in the lead.
Now, as the race comes down to the wire – Ohio’s GOP primary is currently slated for May 3 – things may be tightening up at the top.

Vance slammed Mandel specifically for using his military service record as a cudgel:
“I just [have] to comment on what we just saw.

Answer the question – stop playing around.”
Someone call 911 because I think I just witnessed @JDVance1 murdering @JoshMandelOhio.
After the candidates gave their opening statements, the moderator asked his first question, which set off the fireworks.

and he’s up here ‘hold me back,’ ‘hold me back’ ‘i got two tours in the Marine Corps – what a joke.
Ohio Senate candidates Josh Mandel and Mike Gibbons were in each others’ faces during the debate.
The moderator was forced to step in and break up the pair before the altercation could worsen.
The moderator once again attempted to restore order, and this time gets them to separate.

“Are you saying I owned it?” Gibbons asked Mandel.
“You made millions off it, sir,” Mandel added.
“Two tours in Iraq!” Mandel shouted once more.
“You don’t know squat,” Gibbons said again.
